snippet: The House overwhelmingly approved legislation on Wednesday that would impose the toughest sanctions yet on Iran, calling the measure a critical step to cripple the country’s disputed nuclear program.
abstract: House overwhelmingly approves legislation that would impose toughest sanctions yet on Iran; calls measure a critical step to cripple the country’s disputed nuclear program; critics say Iranian president-elect should first be given a chance to negotiate before sanctions are imposed.
lead_paragraph: The House overwhelmingly approved legislation on Wednesday that would impose the toughest sanctions yet on Iran, calling the measure a critical step to cripple the country’s disputed nuclear program.

headline.main: Sending Message to Iran, House Approves Tougher Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Sending Message to Iran, House Approves Tougher Sanctions
